data.title: nGIST: The new Galaxy Integral-field Spectroscopy Tool
data.name: ngist

evidence: "This is the nGIST pipeline, an actively-developed and updated version of the GIST pipeline. Useful for all galaxy IFS data..." (describes a domain-specific analysis pipeline, i.e., an application users run)

"In its default implementation, nGIST extracts stellar kinematics, creates continuum-only and line-only cubes, performs an emission-line analysis, derives star formation histories and stellar population properties... Outputs are easy-to-read 2D maps .fits files" (directly produces scientific analysis results and data products)

"For a detailed documentation of the nGIST pipeline, including instructions on installation and configuration" and the presence of the GitHub-hosted documentation link imply use via cloning and running from the repository, with no mention of package managers or binaries. The repo is owned by the 'geckos-survey' organization, indicating a survey/research project team.
